Authors:
Shi-Ke Huang, Sajeewa S.N. Maharachchikumbura, Jeewon
Rajesh
Title:
Jahnula dianchia (Jahnulales), a new species recovered from
submerged wood in Dianchi Lake, Yunnan China
Keywords:
Aliquandostipitaceae, Dothideomycetes, morphology, new
species, phylogeny
Abstract:
A novel ascomycete species collected from submerged wood
in Dianchi Lake, Yunnan, China, is described and illustrated as Jahnula
dianchia sp. nov. (Jahnulales, Dothideomycetes). The new taxon is
characterized by dark brown ascospores with mammiform apex. Phylogenetic
analyses of combined ITS, LSU and SSU sequences data place this taxon
within Jahnula as a sister species to the Jahnula sangamonensis..
